dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- the two of you together? The world would have to come to you begging for energy like Oliver Twist with his little bowl of gruel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as the two men stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize that if the press got one whisper of -- I can't fucking believe I'm even discussing this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. It won't come off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Van Loon chuckles, amused by Eddie's audacity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word "brazen" does not even begin to go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have to back off Libya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? He's come this far--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie suddenly pulls back the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you'd want to hear about it from some shmuck who needs a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a gusty little prick, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh. Now you're curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I must admit. You've hit a couple pretty big buttons. Go on. Tell me what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. You get your shot. Come to my office, tomorrow at ten, and tell me just exactly how the schmuck who needs the ride would re- structure this deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie nods.

dialogues.speaker: VAN LOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you better be prepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at your disposal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie opens the car door. Van Loon eyes his building, sco

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't really live here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spartans weren't big on amenities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And they eventually got their asses kicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out. Van Loon drives off.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I didn't go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie keeps walking by his building.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I wanted to walk, move, digest, ingest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His stride picks up, buoyantly.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There are moments in life, moments when you know you've crossed a bridge, your old life is over. Van Loon was my bridge. One week, two weeks from now, I would be hobnobbing with ambassadors, flying to Dubai for meetings, blowing off supermodels, vacationing in Medici villas... And that too, was only a bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps off the curb.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is stepping off another curb, God knows where.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There was another skip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, rocked.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How had I gone that last 20 blocks? I got another ten...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ... then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in mid-step...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is walking past the Metropolitan Museum.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was back uptown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is suddenly sitting at a bar, picking up a drink, people around him...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What bar was this? Was it Harlem...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is dancing with a BEAUTIFUL BLACK WOMAN...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Same bar? Different bar? How long had passed...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks away from her, starts for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie comes to in the act of banging THE BEAUTIFUL BLACK WOMAN savagely, against the stall door.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And it happened again--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bam! A LARGE BLACK MAN crumples in front of Eddie -- goes down, hit, blood pouring from his nose. (Could he be the boyfriend of the girl Eddie's just banged?) Eddie stares his bloody fist. It hurts--!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And again...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits on a plush sofa with several MIDDLE-AGED INTERNATIONAL TYPES, some chattering in Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a drink in his hand. There are paintbrushes, paint and canvasses strewn around... a live/work space.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (And now the images are speeding up:)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is walking down the plush corridor with an ATTRACTI MIDDLE-AGED LATIN WOMAN we saw at the artist's loft... No it's just FLASHES --skimming stones of consciousness-A WI CORK being popped. A PLATE OF MUSSELS swimming in wine sa Rumpled SHEETS. And then...A BLUR OF MOTION -- bodies, a swirl of riotous color --

dialogues.speaker: A FRENZY OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: A DOG LEASH ABANDONED IN A PUDDLE. No rhyme, no reason, j image, image, image...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is walking, now with a limp. He stops. Looks back. familiar postcard view of Manhattan is ahead of him, look like it always looks.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When it finally stopped, I couldn't account for the last eight hours of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices his foot hurts when he puts it down. He has a limp.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There was nothing to do but walk home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and limps back towards the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is sleeping in all his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was my first sleep in two days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, looking very groggy, is holding a THICK PACKET mar "Van Loon Associates, -BY COURIER." The files Carl Van Lo sent. Sitting on the dining table is an MDT tablets. He stares at them.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Should I? Would I start "skipping time" again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the tablets away. Doesn't take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is sitting in his reading chair, exhausted, going through the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Even off MDT, I decided to give Van Loon's files a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie leafs through them... pieces of paper charting corporate growth, covered with charts, graphs, and mind- numbing statistics. PUSH IN ON Eddie's face, as he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They were fucking hieroglyphs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. Kevin Doyle picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello--? Eddie--? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we CROSS-CUT between them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make the meeting, I'm, uh... I'm sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lame excuse, it sounds lame as he says it, but the he's off MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you can't have the fucking flu right now -- he'll never give you this chance again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to, ah, analyze this data-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the two men continue to talk, Kevin growing more agitated, Eddie growing more sheepish as we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Already I recognized it... the thick tongue, the leaden synapses. It was regular Eddie - the Eddie that, now, was unbearable to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FADE UP THE SOUND on the two men:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Don't you get it?! This is your test--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't pass a fucking test right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how am I going to look if you don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks pretty bad. He massages his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Kevin. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands up on a still-yammering Doyle. He picks up the M pill, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was my first morning off MDT in a month. The beginnings of a headache was curling around my head like a big fat, greasy python.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, he looks at the MDT tablet, weighing his options.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But the time-skips had me scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the tablet back down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie walks in, much more tentative in his stride, fear i his eyes. This is the real Eddie, the non-MDT Eddie and h feels suddenly out of place with the curly maple paneling antique Persian carpets.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: My thought -- such as I had one -- was to tap dance with Van Loon until I could find out more about MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits on a couch, Pierce on another chair, Van Loon opposite, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about Hank Atwood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... iconoclast... owns, um, a lot of Colorado...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's struggling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. So this is "prepared," Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots Eddie a look of withering contempt. Eddie holds stare and shoots a look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, Atwood 101? Everyone knows about Atwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was he two years ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of panic in Eddie's eyes. What's the right answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agonizing pause. Then Van Loon nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years ago Forbes didn't even have him on the radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, his Great Leap Forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is faking it. Pierce is looking at him intently. Bu Eddie's staying afloat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy comes on, out of nowhere, so fucking strong he has me on the run. Beat me out of two properties, invests in bumfuck countries with no oil, places I wouldn't go near, sextuples his money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's glance flicks to the TV behind the bar. A WOMAN'S PICTURE flashes on the TV screen -- and he recognizes it. It's the ITALIAN WOMAN he met last night!

dialogues.speaker: VAN LOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...Always picks green technologies, invests in them, and a year later he owns them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie strains to hear the ANCHORWOMAN'S VOICE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... found dead in her hotel room last night, victim of foul play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie tries to keep his face immobile. Van Loon's voice drones on, distorted now, as we HEAR Eddie's heart poundi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...100 billion if he has a nickel... and I have to convince him, somehow, that I can raise his game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unidentified eyewitness has reported seeing a man with a limp leaving the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone with information should contact local law enforcement authorities. --Steve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie bolts upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell me he's in this to improve the fucking planet. He owns a ball team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is pale, sweaty, faint. There's only one thing to d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie dashes out. Van Loon and Pierce look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie bursts from the door, VOMITS into the gutter.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I couldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans against a street sign, trying to right himself. gasps for breath.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...or could I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie comes in, breathing wildly, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If I could walk, talk, conduct business, seduce a woman, fight-- with no memory... could I kill someone? Was it even me? Who was

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately the PHONE RINGS. He nearly jumps out of his s He can't answer. He sits on the couch, head in his hands, rocking, as it rings. Finally, the machine picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Eddie... it's Melissa. Listen, call me back as soon as you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie lunges for the phone, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised he picked up) Eddie--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa, I want to talk to you. Please. Meet me somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonono -- at Charlie's, across the street. At two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't see me, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Melissa -- it's important, please come -- you have to tell me what you're talking about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's already hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's hands rummage through everything...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I realized that there were other people who might know about MDT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hands find what they're looking for. Vernon's LITTLE BLACK BOOK.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Vernon's other clients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits on the bed, the black book open on his knees. Eddie looks at the page, then reaches for the telephone. Picks it up. Hears STRANGE CLICKS over the dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down the phone, fear on his face. 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie walks, slipping through the crowd, trying to suppre his limp... he looks nervously behind him... is that MAN the TAN RAINCOAT following him? He tries to walk faster, it makes his limp more pronounced. He turns the corner. H seems to have lost the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits on a park bench, making calls on his cell phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, may I speak to Paul Kaplan, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a journalist. From Electronics Today magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... my husband died three days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is floored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm so sorry. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie has dialled another number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, ah, may I speak to Jerry Brady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry's in -- who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-- Bill Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Bill... Jerry's in the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and he's really sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. What's wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know. He just started getting these headaches a couple of weeks ago...? Then, uh, last Wednesday he collapsed at work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie turns to the last page of Vernon's book.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Of all the people I called, three were dead, and the rest were sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie dials the last number. Instantly, there is a RING. RACK FOCUS TO-The MAN in the TAN COAT, sitting a discreet distance from Eddie. His phone is ringing. Eddie turns wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man takes out his cell phone and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...? Hello...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man suddenly looks up. Locks eyes with Eddie. Knows t he knows. Eddie leaps up, begins to run. The man leaps up follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie runs desperately, as fast as a person off MDT possi can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still has the limp from his blackout escapade, too. He can't run fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Coat is gaining. Eddie collides with pedestrians, ste on street sunglass displays, sends a saxophonist sprawlin

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In the end, my stupidity saved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, panicked, not looking, runs for the crosswalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is barrelling, unstoppably, right towards him--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE is frozen. The TRUCK SWERVES, up on the curb. Tan C must dive out of the way, knocking down pedestrians like bowling pins, as the TRUCK hits a STREETLIGHT, mangling i then is WHACKED -- twice -- by TWO CABS piling up behind When Tan Coat extracts himself from the pile of prone pedestrians, his last glimpse is of-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: disappearing down into a Subway entrance. Swallowed by a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hesitates, but knows that he can't catch up. Eddie's give him the slip. This time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, limping, enters, looking around anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What was I dealing with? Who could tell me? I hoped against hope... that Melissa would show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not one person in it could possibly be Melissa. Eddie sig Turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Eddie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie turns back. There, sitting at a booth, is a thick- waisted, short-haired brunette middle-aged woman, wearing large, shapeless sweater. Eddie had looked right at her.. and not recognized her. She bears no relationship to the siren Melissa of his memories. Eddie tries to hide the sh on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to her, sits. Yes, it's the same person, but dramatically, tragically changed. Her face is puffy, her pallor blotchy. There are lines under her eyes and around mouth, lines brought on by more than the passage of a few years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie tries to conceal his shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... how are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa responds with a cynical shrug. Then, she eyes him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me I look good, because I know I don't. I didn't want you to see me this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I lost some weight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, MDT'll do that to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They regard each other for minute, unsure of where to sta Old emotions. New emotions. Shock. Dismay. Affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you've been doing it. I just read the Post. Eddie. Short-selling stocks? Second-guessing the markets? You? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you read the Post?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These days, the Post's about all I can read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa, what do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I did it too. And I only took nine or ten hits. Vernon didn't tell you any of this, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melissa snorts as if to say, typical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when he told me about this amazing new drug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was like, down the hatch. And it was amazing. I read Brian Greene's The Elegant Universe in 45 minutes and understood it. My work rate increased... just, insanely, overnight. My boss started to hate me -- they offered me his job. And then I got scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not stupid. I mean, nobody can keep up that level of mental activity and not crash. I stopped taking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got sick. Headaches, throwing up... I went back to Vernon to see if I maybe shouldn't take another hit, or half a hit, and then he told me about... about the people who were dying. One guy didn't die, but he's a vegetable, his mother has to sponge him down every day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much have you been taking, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat as they look into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe they've worked out the bugs. Maybe... maybe this isn't the same batch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hates the look in her eyes. His hands are at his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're off it right now, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you getting a headache?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish your story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't take more. And I didn't die. But after a while I found I couldn't concentrate on anything for longer than ten minutes. I missed deadlines. I got lazy... and slow... put on weight... the magazine let me go. My husband checked out. Sex? Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans back, looks him in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was two years ago, and I haven't been the same since. I can't read any more -- I mean, the fucking New York Post?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie feels ill, physically ill, hearing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After this, I'm going to have a migraine for three days. And I've got to pee. Which is another thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up... goes to the Ladies room. And now Eddie see she wears a LEG BRACE. Like a kid, from the old days, wit Polio.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How many times had I thought of her, my first real love...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see FLASHES OF YOUNG MELISSA...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But that Melissa had unraveled in time and space -- she was a ghost now. I was never going to see her again, never bump into her in the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tears gather behind Eddie's eyes. He can't help it. H puts his hand to his face to hide his emotions. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie leaves with Melissa. He is controlling his tears -- barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have some left? Good. Go home and take it. Take the dose down, but don't just stop -- you'll die if you just stop. Try to taper off. Otherwise, the headache's just the beginning... I have to go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, indeed, is rubbing his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when I run out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I have to go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie catches her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who invented MDT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go of her arm. A puffy, crippled woman about to c She turns her back and moves away from him, stiffly, limp without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No one seemed to be watching my apartment, maybe I could chance it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances around - the coast is clear - and sets off acr the street. He looks weak, ill - his breathing labored. H stumbles - catches himself

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was getting sicker by the moment. Luckily I had one pill on me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls it from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! He's pushed up against the wall of his building. No by Tan Coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By GENNADY THE RUSSIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking forget about me? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is stunned -- Gennady whacked his head against the building pretty hard. He still clutches the MDT tablet ti in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One o'clock? And you not here?! Eddie tries to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come into his apartment, Eddie using all his energy stay upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady turns to ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A check? A check?! You out of your fucking mind?! What you think we are, some financial institution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie realizes his brain isn't working --of course Gennad can't take a check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady, look-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cut your balls off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't thinking. Look, we just need to go to my bank- OOF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady has punched him in the stomach. Harder than he's been punched. Eddie gasps for breath... holds his fist to body, protecting the pill. Gennady notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady grabs Eddie's wrist and wrenches his hand open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's aspirin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady snatches the pill away from him. Examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look like no aspirin I ever see!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice drips with crude contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Something good, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one swift motion, Gennady pops it in his mouth and swallows it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is mute with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's shaking hands are handing Gennady a thick envelop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the whole thing, plus twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks desperately ill. He can barely stand. Gennady, meanwhile, is coming on to MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel good. What in that shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspirin and vitamins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking full of shit, Morgan. I know you lie about the movie script too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to hit Eddie again, but thinks the better of it all the bank cameras. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Gennady give the camera a gay little wave, then tu and walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie lurches along the street, staggering like a drunk, barely able to walk. People avoid him, veering away.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I had to get my stash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy clearly has a mid-level executive job; her office i better than a cubicle and she has a bit of a view. There KNOCK. A FEMALE ASSISTANT appears in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy...? I wouldn't have let him in, but I know you know him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE appears in the door, looking deathly ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl goes. Lindy, sensing something dire, leaps up an closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie immediately collapses on the floor. Lindy kneels do to help him - competent, trying to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie-- What is it--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- I'm sick. I wasn't going to make it home-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay, I'll get you to a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT WON'T HELP--! I need to get-- it's very simple: I need my pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're... for my headaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What headaches? What are you--? (beat, realizing) Are you on some drug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh. So all this energy of yours, all this focus... has been some drug, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not... the way you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That won't--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's PHONE rings. He and Lindy look at each other. He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerie is on the phone. And we CROSS-CUT BETWEEN THEM:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are, indeed, LOUD NOISES coming from above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you tearing up your floor or something?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understanding in Eddie's pained eyes. He clicks off the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I knew what was going on. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MALE HANDS are ripping the place to pieces. Pulling the toilet from the wall. Cutting open the mattress. Taking a Eddie's computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a smart drug...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was supposed to be legal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Eddie... you jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a supply... stashed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows what's coming) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need... to get it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm supposed to just GO?! In the middle of my work day?! To your APARTMENT to get you more DRUGS?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MALE HANDS have found Eddie's hiding place. They LIFT old BROILER of the STOVE... ...and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MDT IS NOT THERE. The broiler is slammed down in ange

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to my apartment. I moved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did--? Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was smart. I was on MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where did you keep it--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, guiltily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy enters. Tense, panicked. She walks to a SQUARE END TABLE, takes the lamp off it. The table is actually a box she lifts the lid. She reaches in... and pulls out the PA OF MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole... in my fucking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, she stuffs it into her purse and goes for the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she leaves, we see that we are in the POV of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: across the street. He clicks open a CELL PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK on the DOOR. Lying on the floor, trying breathe, Eddie ignores it. His PHONE rings again. It take lot of effort just to answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi -- Have you got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we CROSS-CUT BETWEEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy is on the phone. Her voice is tense, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. --Eddie, there's someone following me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got into the cab behind me, and they're making every turn I'm making!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you put me in the middle of--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's traffic. We're slowing down... (to the driver) Go around him! Go around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! We're stopped dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting out, Eddie -- he's walking over here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, helpless on the floor, can do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy bolts from the cab just as TAN COAT puts his hand o the opposite door. She takes off into Central Park. And h after her like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy veers off the path, through the trees, zig-zagging, trying to find a place not to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zig-zags too, not far behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begins to scream, desperate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! Help!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, miraculously, A COP ON HORSEBACK. He steps the horse toward her. She races over and presses her body aga the side of the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's so panicked and out of breath she can barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's... a... man... chasing me. He has a long, tan --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop seems to be paying attention, then suddenly GRUNT and TWITCHES, his eyes flutter, glaze... and HE TOPPLES O HIS HORSE to the ground... ...revealing TAN COAT, on the other side of the horse. The BLADE in his hand is bloody. LINDY runs.... tries to lose herself in a WEDDING PARTY.. comes to a section of huge, decorative BOULDERS and ROCKS Dives behind one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead, she can see the outdoor ICE SKATERS, couples, families, enjoying the ice. It seems surreal. Several yar behind her is TAN COAT, looking behind every tree, every trash bin. Lindy picks up the phone, keeping her voice lo although she's hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we CROSS-CUT BETWEEN:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hiding, but I'm stuck. He'll find me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be still, stop talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed a cop--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to kill me, Eddie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Can he see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking asshole--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he see you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. --I don't know what to do! What do I do--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Reach into the bag and take one of the pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S-swallow one of those things?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Coat is getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will know what do to, Lindy. Take one, and you'll know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got a knife -- I can't think my way out of a knife--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll come on in thirty seconds. And yes, you will think your way out, that's what it does. Are you taking it--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swallows the pill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He's getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Lindy? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. We PUSH IN on Lindy's eyes. Which are changing. Growing more steely. Determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie...? I feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up. Eddie is left looking at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Coat is perhaps five yards behind Lindy and getting closer. But she's not crying any more. She's looking at-T ICE SKATING RINK, and the skaters, whirling across the ic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eyes flash. She knows what to do. Suddenly, she BOLTS fro her hiding place behind the rock, tearing down the hill a fast as she can. Tan Coat is behind her like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy races down the hill, pushing past the line of peopl and onto the ice... Tan Coat is clearly desperate --he doesn't give a shit who sees him chasing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash, he's on the ice after Lindy, running and slid People collide with him, he pushes skaters aside, sending them sprawling... Just as he's closing in on Lindy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy wheels around, grabs a SIX YEAR OLD GIRL under the arms, and HOISTS HER INTO THE AIR, swinging her legs at T Coat as hard she can! The little girl's skates arc throug the air --whoosh! -and connect, CUTTING Tan Coat's FACE. Badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sinks to his knees, hand to his cheek, welling blood. People scream and scatter. Lindy keeps her wits about her She runs, sliding across the ice, and leaping the fence, surprising grace. She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as an MDT pill is put into it. A WIDER SHOT shows Eddie swallowing it with a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits across the room, looking at him, her expression cool composed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, a look of understanding. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie finishes checking in, Lindy beside him. He seems completely restored to his sharp, snappy self. The desk c gives him a key. He puts his arm around her, leads her to elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie takes Lindy's hands, sits her on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll stay here for a couple of days. We'll be powered up, we'll be able to think our way out of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her hands. Looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm back. All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy looks at him for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's back, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take care of you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was never what I wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot's going to happen for us. And everything that I will have... I will share with you. I will love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindy's head comes up. She looks at him, steely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... you were always smart. You could have done this. Not this... but some of these things... maybe a third of these things... without any smart drug at all. A third of all this... to most people...? ...would be plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up, turns away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that stuff now, Eddie. And I don't blame you for taking it. No one could ever tell you, till you take it, what it can do. Invincibility in a bottle. And I know I'm going to think about taking it again every day for the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's eerie quiet to her tone that Eddie hasn't heard before. A matter-of-fact chill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But once you can see everything that way, mapped out like that, on a grid... and always be right...? Who'd want to wing it? Who'd want to fuck up? Who'd want to be human?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came up to say goodbye. I don't ever want to see you again. I'm not even going to stay in New York. Don't try to find me, and don't try to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes. He knows there's no point in stopping her. She' done with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie at the WINDOW, looking down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Lindy briskly walking away. RACK FOCUS as Lindy passes... GENNADY. Leaning against a sign post. Lighting cigarette. And looking up at Eddie's hotel. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady stands there, looking up at the hotel. So he's a little surprised to find EDDIE walking right up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady quickly gets aggressive:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can run out on me? You think I don't know where you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was under the impression that our business was settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is jammed into Eddie's ribs. Something under Gennady's coat. Eddie doesn't blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady walks him around the corner, down some stairs, to (deserted) ground entrance of someone's apartment. Eddie remains cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you're going to rob me? I thought you were a businessman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some more of that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whacks Eddie, hard, across the face. Eddie, stoic, on doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, so do I. You took the last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you get me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get more -- the dealer's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Gennady smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well. Too bad for you. Because how you gonna go to those fancy meetings with your nose fed to my dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie doesn't like that Gennady knows anything about his business life. But he stands his ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I. Can. Do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make some calls. One hundred pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred can't happen. The dealer's dead, I have to call three people to even get a line on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun barrel is brought up beneath Eddie's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I don't really do this. So clean, like this. What I do to you, I do in stages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might... be able to get ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten. Fuck your ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his ground) Ten. And no guarantee there's more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady looks at him for a long, menacing moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I think guarantee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's accepted the ten. For now. He PUSHES Eddie again the wall, hard, knocking the wind out of him.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Self-pity and MDT were not compatible. One has to go on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: being put into Gennady's hand. A wider shot reveals Eddie watching Gennady with contempt as he grabs a fistful of n off a bar table as he goes. Pig.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...Patch up what's left... 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't deny you pissed me off, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sick. I shouldn't have gone to the meeting. I tried to cancel, but Kevin imploded on me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon looks at Eddie penetratingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know who or what I was talking to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and five, is what you were talking to, Carl. Delirium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there can't be any instability. Not when you're playing at this level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent over my revised projections--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for your projections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I think if you look at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat as the two men size each other up. Van Loon l away, but a tiny smile creases the corner of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VAN LOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, there were firings over your projections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...some things my team missed. So, oddly enough, I find myself... needing to fill a position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stays cool. He's in.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Two months after I started MDT, I was helping broker the most important merger in corporate history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits with Van Loon, Pierce, and several POWERFUL LOOKING MEN, conferring. They look at an elaborate chart/graph that Eddie is sketching... even Pierce, his detractor, looks impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is eating a luxurious room service dinner, going through files and projections.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I found that if I maintained an even dose... remembered to eat... drank no alcohol... the blackouts didn't recur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shakes one MDT pill into his hand, downs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is back on the trading floor, a crowd around him.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was quickly back up to speed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is being fitted for new suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it possible to construct an... imperceptible compartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, sir. How large?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite large.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tailor nods, makes a note. He's certainly not going t ask any questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never again stash my MDT, not in an apartment, not in Fort Knox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, buzzing with charismatic authority, speaks to TWO BEEFY MEN, who are professional muscle. (Note: one has ve elaborate tattoos on his fingers.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it known that I have any security. You won't precede me, you'll follow me, never less than ten steps behind... `inconspicuous' doesn't begin to describe you. You're not there. You're a CEO'S wife -- you're wallpaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men nod. They understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie straightens his tie. Then opens his suit jacket, reaches in, and pulls along a seam. An invisible POCKET OPENS.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Safer though my stash now was, I was not sitting around until it ran out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is state of the art, but it's an after-hours, furtive meeting Eddie is having with a TECHNICIAN, who pa back a small PLASTIC ENVELOPE to Eddie. In it we see SEVE TABLETS of MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's nothing you can cook up on a stove top. Whoever made it, it's a real pro act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you make more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I combine these ingredients in the same exact quantities? Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the exact method of delivery to the brain...? Darts at a dartboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clinical trials. Guinea pig people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what it is. Or you'll kill people. You need twelve, eighteen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie tosses the envelope back at him, gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two million dollars if you do it in six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the packet. The guy considers. Then slowly reaches for it, taking the MDT back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is having lunch with several POWER PLAYERS. They ar listening, mesmerized, to what Eddie is saying...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was all going to work out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes flicker upwards. His two SECURITY MEN are seated the bar. The CAMERA PANS to find... Also seated at the ba is the DETECTIVE who questioned Eddie at the police stati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie gets up, "casually" wanders over to where the detec is sitting, pretends to order another drink. He does not eye contact with the detective, or look like he's talking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we straightened this out, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about Vernon Gant, Mr. Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear begins to prick the back of Eddie's neck. But he str for casual annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DETECTIVE hands Eddie a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is turned to the middle, and there is a picture of Edd candid, on the trading floor. That fucking article!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A witness identified the Donatella Alvarez suspect as this person. You want to tell me about your whereabouts on the night of June

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie keeps his cool, does not look scared. Wanders back the table, says a few cool words, and strolls back to the detective. The detective gets up. Shall we go?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Luckily, I could now afford Morris Brandt, the best lawyer in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie walks down the steps, with a beautifully dressed sh lawyer, MORRIS BRANDT, 50's.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Time was bought, and I was released -- for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie's two SECURITY GUYS, waiting, fall into step ten pa behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky somebody wiped the room. Weak circumstantial at best. Just between us -- were you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heard it all, and doesn't really care.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Carl Van Loon and Hank Atwood remained unaware that soon, I would be in a witness lineup as a possible murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is making a presentation to the Van Loon Associates and a skeptical-looking OLDER GUY -- HANK ATWOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...well, a unified front between Van Loon and Atwood would be lethally effective, and not a moment too soon.. SyCorps, Andine and others are jockeying for the same industrial concessions in Mexico that both our companies are secretly sniffing out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the governmental bribe structure is, in itself, corrupt, so of course information about its inner workings, like anything, can be bought. And there are other barbarians waving cash at the gates. I have a list here, in descending order of threat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atwood rubs his temples, seemingly distracted. But then, looks at Eddie piercingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting has broken up. Atwood is leaving, surrounded minions. Van Loon leans into Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie...? What's your read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It flew. Of course, he's not going to tell you right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon notices -- Atwood is using a cane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. He seems frail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be an act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, doesn't track. He's not even 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atwood's gone. Van Loon looks at Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: VAN LOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, Eddie. What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this is over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You haven't given me the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon eyes him. Eddie is only half kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't asked the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. If all this comes off... what's my take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have pre-negotiated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie returns Van Loon's look coolly, implying that it re might be in Van Loon's best interest to trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, given the scale of my contribution, it can't be anything lese than forty. Let's say forty- five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Forty five thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both he and Eddie start to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty million's plenty, Eddie. There's plenty more where this came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to read Eddie's smile which is removed, far away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But you're not going to continue working for me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie opens his mouth. Pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie. You're already bored. Onto the next...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon didn't get to where he is for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: VAN LOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would really love to know what, after a forty million dollar payout, is "next" to you. But you're not going to tell me that, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm not sure I want to know. Might singe my ego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes Eddie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: VAN LOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll open a line of credit for you. Even a tough nut like you's going to want a few toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is being shown the apartment by a thirty-something female REALTOR. The apartment is still under construction brand new -- and enormous, with a wall of floor-to-ceilin windows in the living room showing off spectacular views.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... three restaurants, health club, of course, a private screening room, wine cellar, walk-in humidor... unparalleled, three-tier security system...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks out over the city, feeling a surge. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the asking price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve point five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie has to look away from her, biting his lip. He can't show her any sign of sticker shock. The face he turns bac her is composed, even blase. He shrugs -- no problem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see an almost sexual excitement dance in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was, as it turned out, a good moment to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie comes in. The room has been completely ripped to pi -- just like Eddie's apartment. Eddie just smiles. Becaus there was nothing for anyone to find.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No one knew, or would ever know, that I now carried the pills with me at all times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stands, waiting, his two security guys lurking 10 s behind. GENNADY appears, now with TWO RUSSIAN THUGS of hi own. This is new, and Eddie wasn't expecting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady's security guys eye Eddie's security guys, and vi versa. Gennady is wearing a suit and looks much more sophisticated. Eddie hands Gennady a small envelope. Genn takes it. In his eyes is a penetrating intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Right away, it was obvious he was on MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady whips out a silver lighter and lights himself a cigarette. His movements are elegant, refined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week...? I require twenty pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week? You can fuck yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that you'll feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady's eyebrow goes up. Gennady's security guys reach their jackets. So do Eddie's guys. Gennady's eyes flick o the situation, motion to his guys to keep still. Gennady laughs, an unpleasant sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think your Forbes 400 new financial friends would appreciate the details of your little dilemma with the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady turns with a flourish and walks off. Over his shoulder, with smug confidence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thursday. You have them here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady turns, walks to the curb, where a NEW BLACK TOWN is waiting for him and his boys.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Obviously, this could not go on. But there is very little on this earth that 45 million dollars can't solve. And tomorrow at nine, Atwood would sign the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, Van Loon and associates are all waiting in the conference room. The clock on the wall reads 9:40. Van Lo looks glum. A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you want to call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was all last night to tell us that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon pushes the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: VAN LOON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, the decision could have changed -- that makes sense -- but the discourtesy doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, based on your graphs and projections?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw his eyes: it's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, remind me: who the fuck, exactly, are YOU?! --I'm sorry, Carl, I'm about at the end with this unqualified, posturing little-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull it back, Pierce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is this little pisher the fucking Delphi Oracle?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Van Loon, Mrs. Atwood is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Van Loon look at each other. What? Van Loon nod Eddie; the two men get up. Pierce starts to get up too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce, you can stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierce looks bitter -- chastened -- as Van Loon and Eddie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon and Eddie enter, to find MRS. HANK ATWOOD, a wel dressed, well-preserved and beautiful 50, standing at Van Loon's desk.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ATWOOD
dialogues.text: I wanted this to be as confidential as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon and Eddie can't imagine what's coming next.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ATWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My husband experienced some pain and dizziness this morning. He's at Lenox Hill, undergoing tests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She speaks with great dignity, distraught, but tightly controlled.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ATWOOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Obviously, it wouldn't be in our best interests for this to be reported by the press, as it might put some of his interests at risk. I just want you to know that we have every intention of signing the contract, and, as soon as he is able, we will proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Van Loon flank Mrs. Atwood, walking her to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I realize that this is a useless platitude, but... if there's anything we can do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously we want to be as helpful and respectful as possible.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ATWOOD
dialogues.text: Thank you so much. I rely on your discretion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes both of their hands. A driver has the door ope for her; she gets in, now out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think there's a proxy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cagey fuck like him giving away power of attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shakes his head. The two men look at each other dar The driver closes her door, turns -- and now Eddie can se his face. It's TAN COAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a huge, angry scar slashed across his cheek. Eddie a Tan Coat look at each other. A steely moment of recogniti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Coat turns away, gets in the driver's side. Van Loon watches the car pull away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. He'd better get better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on Eddie's face. Who now knows.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But Atwood wouldn't get better. Because Atwood was out of MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, beautifully dressed, walks. Ten paces behind walk SECURITY GUYS. He is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Well. Why be surprised? How many other meteoric rises might be explained by MDT? At least I had some; my life wasn't in jeopardy. Only my money...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...and my liberty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stands with his favorite POLICE DETECTIVE and his lawyer in an anteroom leading to an institutional door. H lawyer talks to him, low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been all over them... we can't allow any disparity in race or physical type between you and the rest of the lineup -- they're as close to your clones as I could possibly get away with -- it's going to be one big handsome blur to this guy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE COP approaches Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Morgan...? I need you to change your jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's me... I want everyone in the same shirt, better for the blur factor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another beat of hesitation... then Eddie hands Brandt his jacket, takes off his shirt, puts on the blue shirt... an stoically follows the female cop through the grubby door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please turn to the right. Eddie and four other dark-haire guys turn to the right. Eddie looks at the black one-way window.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who was out there? The woman's husband? Was some bellboy I undertipped about to end my life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the dimmest clue. He was dithering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie blinks at him.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS BRANDT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Maybe the third from the right... No not him..." --Oh. Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Eddie back his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS BRANDT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: the jacket) Thing of beauty. You had it made?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie just nods, his eyes steely. The lawyer feels the mo stare and hands the jacket back. 99.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They'd kept me all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie rushes down the steps, two at a time, looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'd missed my meeting with Gennady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady, wearing a gorgeous cashmere coat, waits, now wit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady looks at his watch, then says something low and sinister in Russian to his associates.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But I had more important business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hurries into the room. Van Loon doesn't look up. He watching a monitor, which has a live news feed to a finan channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And the Dow has been yo-yoing all day, amidst speculation that Van Loon Associates and Hank Atwood have negotiated a merger...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Van Loon turns to Eddie, furious, agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been talking to anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been, Eddie--? This is the second time you've turned to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal time, Carl. Phone off. You're not telling me there's been any movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Atwood's in a coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black looks between them as the newscaster continues.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It had gotten out, somehow. But I felt thick, stupid, tired. A small pain was starting behind my eyes. I'd been unable to take my MDT, and I was overdue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots Van Loon a glance. Van Loon is miserably fixate the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie stands in a stall. Reaches into the lining of his c Unfastens the opening of the compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: panicked, feels again. Nothing. The MDT is simply not there!!! He begins to hyperventilate. Spin in place. Push against the stall walls, trying not to scream.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Was it Brandt? Or someone else? The police station? A coat room? How? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bursts from the stall, alone in the bathroom. Stares a himself, terrified, in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In an hour I'd be useless. In two I'd be sick. In 24, dead. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie bursts from the bathroom. Trying not to look too wi eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie--? This came for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks at a LARGE BOX on Van Loon's desk. Indeed, hi name is on it. Eddie, mystified, approaches it. As Van Lo continues to stare at the TV, disinterested in the box, E gingerly opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside are the SEVERED HANDS OF EDDIE'S SECURITY GUYS. (O black hand, one with the distinctive tattoos.) Gennady. Clearly these guys are dead. Eddie grabs the box and star from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Eddie--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Eddie's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are leaving for the night. Eddie shoves past them, still holding the damning box, frightened, jacked up, desperate, shoving people out of the way to get to the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits in the back seat, the box freakishly sitting beside him.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I couldn't think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His brow is beaded with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Only MDT could help me. I had no MDT. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on Eddie's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We begin to REWIND... in Eddie's mind... through many IMA we've seen in this movie... stopping briefly at all the places Eddie has stashed his MDT.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ... anywhere at all...I could have left one pill...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We STOP at the END TABLE in Lindy's apartment, peer insid Empty. We STOP at the UNDERSIDE of the GRILL on Eddie's o stove. Nothing. We continue to REWIND -- but every image stop on reveals... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I had to keep thinking. Somewhere safe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sits at his huge new steel dining table, the evil b on the table in front of him, head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (The room is filled with labeled boxes he has never had a chance to unpack.) The TV is on in the background. It's a financial channel. We see MRS. HANK ATWOOD is giving a statement.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HANK ATWOOD
dialogues.text: There is absolutely no truth to the rumor of this merger. None whatsoever. My husband is having some tests, this is a difficult time, and I would appreciate your directing further questions to our attorney...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions at the gentleman next to her. --Who is also Eddie's attorney, MORRIS BRANDT. The one who was so helpf with the police. The one who held his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitter amusement in Eddie's eyes. At least he knows. The APARTMENT BUZZER buzzes. Eddie freezes. Looks at the door BUZZES again.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It wasn't downstairs security, alerting me to a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was my inner door. Someone was in the building, ten feet away, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie walks to his phone, picks it up. Pushes the button, puts it to his ear. It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the "on" button again and again. Nothing. The buzzer BUZZES again. Eddie rushes to the door, opens the CLOSET. In the closet is a state-of-the-art SECURITY MONI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady and TWO MEN are outside his door! Suddenly the MONITOR goes BLACK. Eddie flicks the switch on the monito Nothing. Eddie flicks the switch again. It's dead. Someon somewhere, has figured out how to disarm it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzzer BUZZES again. Eddie backs away from the door. HEAR Eddie's shallow, panicked breathing. He lunges for h briefcase, pulls out his CELL PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads "No Signal." BAM! The first slam on the door beg BAM! The second. The door holds, but Eddie begins to back away in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly FADE TO BLACK. And FADE IN ON:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so... here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we pick up Eddie where we left him, standing on t ledge.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I knew they would kill me, slowly and horribly. But this choice would at least be mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now hear the ZZZZZZZZ! of some major power tool drilli at the door, punctuated by more BAMS! -- one way or anoth they're going to get in. Eddie takes a breath, tries to j He can't.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But we're instinctive creatures. We want to live.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So, my foggy brain tried to remember... where one tablet of MDT... might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PUSH IN on Eddie's eyes... We are still REWINDING in Eddie's mind... images of where we've seen him keep MDT.. nothing... nothing... nothing... We STOP at the SUGARBOWL Eddie's dining table. Then go forward --no, wait!-rewindi stopping again on the SUGAR BOWL. Pushing in on the sugar bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie spins around, looks back into his apartment, eyes intense.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was possible. And possible was enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is tearing through boxes as the POUNDING and DRILLI become deafening... he rips open a box labeled "Kitchen" it's full of BOOKS. Mis-labeled. JUMP CUTS as he rips ope other boxes... his hands frantically scattering CDs, cutl cans of food... The door begins to give. Under the deafen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE JUMP-CUTS as Eddie hysterically tears the packing pa off of promisingly- shaped objects. --No. A glass. --No. vase. --YES! The sugar bowl. With sugar still inside! Edd rummages, frantically, among the sugar cubes as the door gives a few inches, groaning, and we glimpse blurred face the other side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pokes, wildly, among the cubes... pushing them aside, revealing at the bottom of the bowl-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE MDT TABLET looks back up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's really there! Eddie grabs it, just as, with a splintering CRASH! -- The door goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie steps back, brings the pill up to his mouth... But he steps, he TRIPS on a SOUP CAN he's scattered... he FAL backwards... his HAND hits the side of the coffee table..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MDT TABLET goes flying... (slow motion)... as... ...a in slow motion, Gennady and his two thugs smile as they advance into the room... THE MDT TABLET... flies... flies towards a GRATE in the floor -- a heating vent -- and HIT it... rolling... ... before disappearing forever down the grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie knows that's it. His life has ended. He sucks in hi last breath -- then, with a YELL, he rushes back for the terrace... for his suicide leap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug #1 is quicker. Gets to the door first. Eddie will no have the luck to be able to jump. He's trapped between th two Thugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I want more. You don't listen. Maybe you think I'm joking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his coat pocket...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm down to this last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and pulls out a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I dissolve pill in solution. You shoot it - goes straight into blood and to brain. Works much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the plastic sleeve off the needle. Jabs himself the arm and injects the cloudy liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. Where do you keep yours?
