dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is backed to the wall. Nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm plum out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady just smiles -- that was an unfortunate choice. He gives an order to the Thugs who grab their tools and disappear deeper into the apartment. WE HEAR them startin tear things up. Gennady and Eddie are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will find it. Or I will make you tell me. Which is quicker? We see, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks open a BLACK ATTACHE CASE. It is filled with sinister-looking silver instruments, and knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug #2 has found, behind a bureau, a SAFE. He calls excitedly, in Russian, to the other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady calls back in Russian. Then picks up a particular delicate, yet sharp-looking KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a waste of my time, you know that? I am getting out of this part of the business... starting import-export company. Very exciting stuff. A lot on my plate. I need to learn to delegate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is backed up against a table, which is covered with stuff he's scattered, which includes a BUTCHER BLOCK with KNIFE in it... Gennady starts arranging his instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, I will cut skin from you, flay you... you stay alive nice long time... then maybe we cut meat from you, steaks... or maybe softer parts... I get inspiration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up, smiles, to see the effect his words have on Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring back at Gennady, hard, a fuck-you stare. We can't behind Eddie's back, but we can see the butcher block, an the knife is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: senses something is not right. Looks at Eddie quizzically

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie brings the knife up as hard as he can, right into Gennady's stomach. Gennady gasps in surprise, chokes, writhes. Eddie drives the knife home, harder, grabbing Gennady's other hand, which lashes at Eddie with the fill knife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men fall to the floor in a death-struggle. Eddie exhausted, off MDT, but determined not to let go. Gennady writhes, flails, but doesn't cry out... he's already chok on blood. Eyes shocked, surprised. Eddie turns the fillet knife back on Gennady, slashes at his other arm; blood spurts. But it's not necessary. Gennady's eyes are glazin His gurgling gets quieter. He's quite dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie lies alongside him, panting, arm grazed and welling blood from where Gennady's filleting knife slashed him, suddenly weak and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other room comes the BRRRRRRR! sound of the dril the boys, oblivious, are hard at work on the safe. Eddie tries to get up, then falls back.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not much of a triumph, was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the shakes... no, more of a convulsion... he sin back to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Because I would die here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a break in the convulsion. Then another one star

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Only MDT could help me, and the last of it was in this fuck's bloodstream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gennady's BLOOD wells around Gennady's body in a crimson puddle. A puddle that's creeping closer and closer to Edd face, which is lying, convulsing, on the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: between convulsions, suddenly looking. Looking at the blo It creeps closer to Eddie's face. Eddie is trying to move trying to push his face closer to the blood... he's there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now he turns his face down into the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And begins to lap it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Thug finally gets the safe open. Inside is only one i -the TATTOOED SECURITY MAN's SEVERED HAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And its middle finger has been arranged in a vehement fuc you. The thugs are not amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs are coming down the hall, muttering angrily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouth smeared with blood, Eddie is dragging himself by th elbows, across the room. Footsteps coming. Fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst into the room, see Gennady dead on the floor. camera WHIP-PANS around. No Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie lies, panting. And then it hits. We PUSH IN on Eddi eyes. He feels it. His old friend. MDT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: look up at a NOISE. Just in time to see Eddie bolting out front door of the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come thundering out -- see a flash of Eddie disappea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in jittery, handheld THUG'S POV shot as they burst back in, barreling by rooms, looking in them, pressing on more rooms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug #2 BLASTS his GUN... the MAN crumples, the glass doo behind him EXPLODE...... the MAN goes down...revealing Ed standing behind him --(he's been holding up his neighbor' body) and, just as this registers -- WHACK! -- Eddie give THUG #1 a savage shot with a fireplace poker. Thug #1 goe down, unconscious... the gun skitters across the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUG #2 dives, reaches for it. Eddie grabs a piece of the shattered glass and, in a vicious swipe, brings it down o the Thug's hand. But this guy is not a tough Russian motherfucker for nothing. Bleeding profusely, he doesn't go of the gun... his bloody hand comes up, tries to aim..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie DIVES BACKWARDS, through the broken glass door to t patio. The thug stumbles after him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE'S HAND, still holding glass, CUTS the awning-rope holding up the awning... The awning comes down on the thu huge canvas curtain DROPPING between the Thug and Eddie. BLAM! BLAM! Several holes appear in the canvas as the thu tries to shoot Eddie anyway, but Eddie has leapt out of t way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he wrestles it off... he sees Eddie, on the ground, pr just watching him calmly. He starts to smirk. Eddie touch MATCH to the ground. The FLAME shoots across the floor to thug, who now realizes he's standing in a puddle, the overturned can of BBQ fluid next to him. In an instant, h LEGS AND PANTS are on fire. Now the man screams. Shoots blindly. But - click! -- is out of bullets. He rushes at Eddie, screaming, on fire, in animal rage. Eddie brings u wrought-iron patio chair to meet him, catching him square in the ribs. He gasps, bends over... looks up at Eddie, beaten...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The face that looks back is without pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking up at the penthouse. A SHAPE is dropping, fast, towards us -- the shape of a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's here! The man's head EXPLODES against the railing li pumpkin as the rest of him disappears down, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Later, it would be noted that my neighbor was in the music business. One of his drug deals had obviously gone bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the night was still young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN is on a gurney. A NURSE puts a sheet over his head. Before our view of his face disappears we realize --it's Atwood. Dead. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Coat is sitting, stoic and red-eyed in a chair. He se something. Slowly turns his head and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE is sitting in the chair next to him. The two men lo at each other for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you're curious about what's happened to your boss. I certainly am. If my attorney was really working for Mr. Atwood, to save his life, then why is he dead? At what point was the Pony Express supposed to ride in with the life- saving medication?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, did the Pony decide that he should be running his own Pony show? Minus the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tan Coat stares at him, his face without expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN UPPERCLASS HOUSEWIFE enters, in sweats, from the gym. Immediately notices something is not right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place has been ransacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes in. We SEE her husband - MORRIS BRANDT - tied and gagged, struggling on the floor. Next to him, a smash PICTURE. It once covered a WALL SAFE which is now open. T SAFE is empty.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I would not go back. I would not be stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TITLE: Eight months later 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desks, employees, volunteers, ringing phones. REUBEN, LAT 20's, sharp, a JAMES CARVILLE-TYPE, sits on a desk with casual authority, is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...actually, no, there's no more tickets. --Yeah, I know, an overbooked fundraiser -- there's a first -- well, here he comes, I'll ask him -- Edward!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Eddie striding down the corridor, wearing a sharp suit, looking more dignified than we've ever seen him, mo adult. The snap and crackle of something new -- power -- in his step. TWO MALE AIDES flank him. Reuben approaches, falls into step with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're looking at a second, overflow event-- there's a wave of donations coming in -- and I don't think they're even going to try a second debate -- don't go yet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have arrived at Eddie's office. Reuben nods at the closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John Steadman's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Eiben-Chemcorps? Look, they're your biggest contributor, give him his two shitty little minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sighs, capitulating. Puts his hand on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eiben-Chemcorps. What are they -- research?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pharmaceuticals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie shoots him a look. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie comes in to find JOHN STEADMAN, 50's, well-dressed gentlemanly, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes Steadman's hand, but Steadman doesn't get up. O In fact Steadman looks uncommonly relaxed, almost slouche his chair, looking up at Eddie with a subtle gleam in his that Eddie doesn't recognize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We appreciate everything you've done for us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've done most of it for yourself. Senator Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says this with a kind of casual, prescient authority. suddenly, we know he's right. Eddie will win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, everything from here's a technicality, isn't it, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, that smile. Eddie doesn't know what this guy is about. And nobody calls him "Eddie" any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we both know where it's heading...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If... you can maintain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eventually you'll run out. I just want you to know we're here to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie blinks at him. Did he just say what Eddie thought h said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotten most of the bugs out. It's longer lasting - you'll only have to take one a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is now dead silent. A long beat. Is it possible? Is he really talking to someone who makes MDT?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been watching me from the beginning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Those of you who indulged... distinguished yourselves very quickly. You made yourselves clear to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's "us?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman just smiles, waves the question away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went the furthest with it the fastest, so of course, to us, you're the most interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it get on the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security breach. That was never our intention. We took care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning, they took care of Vern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will never again be on the street. It will never publicly exist. Obviously I don't need to detail the advantages for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Eddie doesn't trust this guy -- not a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about for you? Why don't you take it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to. You'll take it for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in return...? I do what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep on doing what you're doing. We won't bother you much at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And later...? What will you be "bothering" me with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, given where you're heading, some of our ideas are... grandiose. But, I think, achievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie takes that in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I don't like your ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll say Godspeed. And your candle will have shed a brief, but lovely, light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie knows now. They own his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But let's not even go there. Right now you should feel relieved, your problems are over. We just want to keep you healthy... and brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily I can do that myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no, ah, that won't be the case. We shut your lab down this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman doesn't blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman suddenly chuckles -- not at all concerned by thi Even amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were right about you Eddie - you're gonna go all the way. Let's not do anything to jeopardize that. There's no downside here - we're offering you a limitless supply with fewer side effects. I think you'll be pleased with the arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's get some lunch. I'm starving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the door. Eddie remains still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman stops, looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I kill that woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman looks puzzled that Eddie would ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie thinks. No, he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Steadman exit, come down the steps, Eddie looki thrown. He drifts along, half-a-step behind Steadman, dee in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so bad, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't every man on the path to greatness have to tolerate the wind- drag of compromise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black LIMO waits at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overall, we'll all be better off... foreign policy, the courts, even the Constitution could stand a little tweaking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They descend the last few steps. Steadman opens the limo door for Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Eddie hesitates. Doesn't get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, "Senator". You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie gestures for him to get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in. And Eddie CLOSES THE DOOR AFTER HIM. Stands outside the limo, looking back at Steadman through the ro down window, his face a cold mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now. Don't underestimate us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't underestimate your own creation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman looks at him quizically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you invented it. What does it do? It puts me 50 steps ahead of you fucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I didn't spend my days on MDT devising a personal defense structure that would scare the shit out of the Israelis--? You think there's not people with a bead on you right now, right in this building? You think this conversation is private?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know the caliber of enemies you'll be making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to push that button? I'll show you my silos if you show me yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll run out. You'll die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or I'll think of something. Isn't that what MDT does? Makes you think of something? Might even tell me how to get off it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker in Steadman's eyes. Anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I just ask the drug... how to tell the drug... how to fuck itself? I mean, isn't it like the 8-ball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steadman raises his hand to the driver and the limo pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It always answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the limo recedes into the distance, Eddie finally exha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And only then do we see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's scared.
